$description: Table/data grid component tokens. Tables display structured data in rows and columns for scanning, comparing, and analyzing information. These tokens compose primitive tokens into table-specific configurations. Use tables for: data listings, comparison matrices, financial data, admin panels, search results. ACCESSIBILITY: Use semantic table elements (thead, tbody, th with scope) and consider row/column headers for screen readers.

borderRadius.$description: Table container border radius (4px). Slight rounding softens the table container. Only applies to outer border, not individual cells.

borderWidth.$description: Table border width (1px). Thin borders define cells without visual heaviness. Used for outer border and cell dividers.

cell.$description: Table cell configuration. Cells contain data and need appropriate padding for readability.

fontSize.$description: Table cell font sizes. Slightly smaller than body text to fit more data while remaining readable.

lg.$description: Large table font size (16px). Larger text for improved readability. Good for simple tables or accessibility needs.

md.$description: Medium table font size (14px). DEFAULT. Same as sm - keeps data compact while maintaining readability.

sm.$description: Small table font size (14px). Standard data table text. Readable and space-efficient for most use cases.

xl.$description: Extra large table font size (16px). Same as lg - body text size for maximum readability in spacious tables.

xs.$description: Extra small table font size (12px). Compact text for dense data tables. Use for admin panels or data-heavy views.

padding.$description: Cell padding controls data density. Horizontal padding affects column separation; vertical padding affects row height.

lg.$description: Large horizontal cell padding (20px). Spacious tables with generous breathing room. Good for simple data with few columns.

md.$description: Medium horizontal cell padding (16px). DEFAULT. Comfortable spacing for readable data. Recommended for most use cases.

sm.$description: Small horizontal cell padding (12px). Standard density for most data tables. Good balance of data and whitespace.

xl.$description: Extra large horizontal cell padding (32px). Very spacious tables for presentation or limited data. Maximum readability.

xs.$description: Extra small horizontal cell padding (10px). Dense tables for compact data display. Use when horizontal space is limited.

lg.$description: Large vertical cell padding (12px). Taller rows for better touch targets and readability. Good for mobile or complex cell content.

md.$description: Medium vertical cell padding (8px). DEFAULT. Comfortable row height for general use. Good for scanning and selecting rows.

sm.$description: Small vertical cell padding (6px). Standard density rows for most data tables. Efficient use of vertical space.

xl.$description: Extra large vertical cell padding (16px). Maximum row height for spacious tables. Use for rich cell content or presentation.

xs.$description: Extra small vertical cell padding (4px). Compact rows for dense data display like logs or detailed admin views.

color.$description: Table component color tokens. These reference semantic color tokens for theme-aware styling.

header.$description: Table header row configuration. Headers label columns and typically have distinct styling.

fontSize.$description: Table header font size (14px). Same as cell text but distinguished by weight and color. Consistent sizing aids alignment.

fontWeight.$description: Table header font weight (600). Semibold headers clearly distinguish column labels from data. Important for scanability.

duration.$description: Table row hover transition duration (100ms). Fast transition for responsive hover feedback on rows.
